column1: Jocelyn is a student from Mexico specializing in robotics and hardware engineering.
Jocelyn actively participates in RoboCup competitions focusing on autonomous robots.
Jocelyn's hardware experience includes working with STM32 microcontrollers and embedded systems.
Jocelyn is fluent in Spanish and Englishx and has basic knowledge of German.
Jocelyn was a member of a FIRST Robotics team during high school.
Currently Jocelyn works at MLH organizing hackathons and supporting fellowship programs with Meta.
Jocelyn's current research interests are in brain-computer interfaces and neurotechnology.
Jocelyn enjoys building robots and experimenting with sensors and actuators.
Jocelyn collaborates with international teams in robotics competitions.
Jocelyn's goal is to advance human-computer interaction using neural signals.
